algorithms module

algorithms.custom_placement_algorithm(board: list[list[str | None]], ships: dict[str, int], placement: dict[str, list[str]]) → list[list[str | None]][source]

Places ship according to a dict with specified coordinates and rotations

Parameters:

  • board (Board) – Board to modify

  • ships (dict[str, int]) – Dictionary of all ship types and its length, does not contain any coordinates or rotation data

  • placement (dict[str, list[str]]) – Dictionary of ship coordinates and corresponding rotations

Returns:

A reference to the same instance as the original board passed in the board argument

Return type:

Board

algorithms.random_placement_algorithm(board: list[list[str | None]], ships: dict[str, int], max_attempts: int = 100) → list[list[str | None]][source]

Places ships in random coordinates and rotations using brute-force

Parameters:

  • board (Board) – Board to modify

  • ships (dict[str, int]) – Dictionary of all ship types and its length, does not contain any coordinates or rotation data

  • max_attempts (int, optional) – Maximum attempts to brute-force, defaults to 100

Raises:

MaxAttemptsReached – Gives up when max_attempts is reached

Returns:

A reference to the same instance as the original board passed in the board argument

Return type:

Board

algorithms.simple_placement_algorithm(board: list[list[str | None]], ships: dict[str, int]) → list[list[str | None]][source]

Places ships horizontally, one ship per row

Parameters:

  • board (Board) – Board to modify

  • ships (dict[str, int]) – Dictionary of all ship types and its length, does not contain any coordinates or rotation data

Returns:

A reference to the same instance as the original board passed in the board argument

Return type:

Board
